required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Neck Extension Exercise Using 8 Channel Surface Electromyography
clinical_study.official_title: Analysis of Abnormal Muscle Activities on Forward Neck Posture Syndrome Patients and Effect of Neck Extension Exercise Using 8 Channel Surface Electromyography

brief_summary.textblock: Analysis of Abnormal Muscle Activities on Forward Neck Posture Syndrome Patients and Effect of Neck Extension Exercise Using 8 Channel Surface Electromyography

detailed_description.textblock: In this study, the investigators investigate the muscle contraction according to posture change in patients with forward neck posture syndrome which was not revealed by 8 channel surface electromyography and provide accurate evaluation of forward neck posture syndrome in comparison with normal group and to be used as basic research data for the development of 8 channel electric stimulation therapy device.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from 8 Channel Surface Electromyography at 4 weeks
primary_outcome.time_frame: when patient enrolled and after 4 weeks
primary_outcome.description: measure the area and extent of muscle activation around the cervical vertebrae according to posture

secondary_outcome.measure: Change the angle of cervical vertebrae from plain x-ray at 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.time_frame: when patient enrolled and after 8 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: measure the angle of cervical vertebrae

arm_group.description: Patients diagnosed with forward neck posture syndrome in cervical plain X-ray have a cervical spine extension exercise for 4 weeks

intervention.description: cervical spine extension exercise for 4 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy adults over the age of 20 who do not have any underlying disease that does not appeal to forward neck posture syndrome 2) Among adults who complained of chronic pain over three months, patients aged 20 years and over who were diagnosed with forward neck posture syndrome in a simple x-ray of the lumbar spine
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with severe neurological disorders (procedural hypertrophy), previous cervical surgery, impaired eye diseases, spinal deformations, rehabilitation for strengthening spinal muscles within the last three months and pregnant women
